channel.title: SQLException being thrown

item.title: SQLException being thrown
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:14, topic:263677”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=348237.msg2681988#msg2681988 date=1235431126]

Why are you doing [tt]while(Engine.manager.set.next())[/tt]?

im guessing that variable is the result set, thus he’s checking all the returned info and populating the results into the array because he has many rows of data. note this will just be overwritten because the array is just gunna get overwritten till the last row comes and use that data

Exactly my point. It is technically pointless to loop through rows he isn’t even going to read.
[/quote]
irrelevent cause thats after his exception is being thrown[/quote]

Well it does fix a future bug, anyway.

Read full topic

im guessing that variable is the result set, thus he’s checking all the returned info and populating the results into the array because he has many rows of data. note this will just be overwritten because the array is just gunna get overwritten till the last row comes and use that data
[/quote]

Exactly my point. It is technically pointless to loop through rows he isn’t even going to read.[/quote]
irrelevent cause thats after his exception is being thrown

item.title: SQLException being thrown
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Ya, that’s what i tried doing:

SELECT * FROM Information WHERE `Merger ID` = ?

and then using the column names, that i know are there, like Q1, and it is then that it throws the exception.

Read full topic

item.title: SQLException being thrown
item.dc:creator: @deadly72 deadly72
item.description:
@deadly72 wrote:

you can still get all of the information; a prepared statement can be used with the searching condition WHERE Merger ID = ? and because thats the first ? you set the variable using setInt(1, valueYouWantToSearch) note i used setInt because Merger ID should be an integer. As far as getting all the info w/o knowing how many columns there are you can use the asterix and that will selects all info from the table.

Read full topic

item.title: SQLException being thrown
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

I hadve no problem using createStatement() i was just following a tutorial, and it used a PReparedStatement. THe problem is that in the tutorial, it names all of the columns, like

SELECT a, b, c FROM...

whereas is want to be able to get the same information, even if i don’t know how many columns there are.

Read full topic

item.title: SQLException being thrown
item.dc:creator: @deadly72 deadly72
item.description:
@deadly72 wrote:

if you insist on using a prepared statement

            Engine.manager.prepareStatement = Engine.manager.connect.prepareStatement("SELECT * FROM Information WHERE `Merger ID` = ?");
            Engine.manager.setInt(1, key);

key will be the value your method accepts, then all you have to do is execute your query.

Should be something around those lines.

Read full topic

item.title: SQLException being thrown
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

try not using a preparedstatement (use Engine.manager.connect.createStatement()), also how many rows do you have, if theres a lot you would want to increase jvm memory using -Xmx

Read full topic

item.title: SQLException being thrown
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Sorry, i’m on a Modified 2001 iMac. Clipboard got messed up. I’m working on a PS atm, but this isn’t a question about that. I’m working on a sort of stock exchange simulator for a school project[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 21, 2009, 07:27:03 pm[/size][hr]Here’s something else i tried:

public int[] getInfo(int key) {
        int[] info = new int[7];
        
        try {
            Engine.manager.query = "SELECT * FROM Information WHERE `Merger ID` =" + key;
            Engine.manager.statement = Engine.manager.connect.prepareStatement(Engine.manager.query);
            Engine.manager.set = Engine.manager.statement.executeQuery(Engine.manager.query);
            
            while(Engine.manager.set.next()) {
                info[0] = Engine.manager.set.getInt("Merger ID");
                info[1] = Engine.manager.set.getInt("Current Buy Price");
                info[2] = Engine.manager.set.getInt("Current Sell Price");
                info[3] = Engine.manager.set.getInt("Q1 Ending Price");
                info[4] = Engine.manager.set.getInt("Q2 Ending Price");
                info[5] = Engine.manager.set.getInt("Q3 Ending Price");
                info[6] = Engine.manager.set.getInt("Q4 Ending Price");
            }
        }
        
        catch(Exception error) {
            error.printStackTrace();
        }
        
        return info;
    }

And here’s the error:

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
        at com.mysql.jdbc.ResultSetImpl.getInstance(ResultSetImpl.java:362)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.buildResultSetWithRows(MysqlIO.java:2532)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.getResultSet(MysqlIO.java:477)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.readResultsForQueryOrUpdate(MysqlIO.java:2510)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.readAllResults(MysqlIO.java:1746)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.sqlQueryDirect(MysqlIO.java:2135)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.ConnectionImpl.execSQL(ConnectionImpl.java:2536)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.ConnectionImpl.execSQL(ConnectionImpl.java:2465)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.StatementImpl.executeQuery(StatementImpl.java:1383)
        at com.zymus.zenith.stock.Stocks.getInfo(Stocks.java:84)
        at com.zymus.zenith.stock.Stocks.loadStockInfo(Stocks.java:365)
        at com.zymus.zenith.stock.Stocks.<init>(Stocks.java:28)
        at com.zymus.zenith.Engine.<init>(Engine.java:94)
        at com.zymus.zenith.StockServer.main(StockServer.java:44)

Read full topic

pretty sure you cant use a prepared statement like that
also, your table names/key name doesnt match…

item.title: SQLException being thrown
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

MySQL, here’s the structure:

SET NAMES latin1;
SET FOREIGN_KEY_CHECKS = 0;

CREATE TABLE `Information` (
  `Merger ID` int(11) NOT NULL,
  `Current Buy Price` int(11) NOT NULL,
  `Current Sell Price` int(11) NOT NULL,
  `Q1 Ending Price` int(11) NOT NULL,
  `Q2 Ending Price` int(11) NOT NULL,
  `Q3 Ending Price` int(11) NOT NULL,
  `Q4 Ending Price` int(11) NOT NULL
) ENGINE=MyISAM DEFAULT CHARSET=latin1;

insert into `Information ` values
('0','15','11','80','0','0','0'),
('1','17','14','80','0','0','0'),
('2','4','2','80','0','0','0');

SET FOREIGN_KEY_CHECKS = 1;

Read full topic

item.title: SQLException being thrown
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Hi, I’m making a program that pulls info from a MySQL database. The problem is trying to call the getInt(String columnName) method, and i get a SQLException being thrown. I’ve tried fixing it, but it haven’t had any luck. Here’s the code:

public int[] getInfo(int key) {
        int[] info = new int[7];
        
        try {
            Engine.manager.query = "SELECT * FROM Information WHERE `Merger ID` =" + key;
            Engine.manager.statement = Engine.manager.connect.prepareStatement(Engine.manager.query);
            Engine.manager.set = Engine.manager.statement.executeQuery(Engine.manager.query);
            
            info[0] = Engine.manager.set.getInt("Merger ID");
            info[1] = Engine.manager.set.getInt("Current Buy Price");
            info[2] = Engine.manager.set.getInt("Current Sell Price");
            info[3] = Engine.manager.set.getInt("Q1 Ending Price");
            info[4] = Engine.manager.set.getInt("Q2 Ending Price");
            info[5] = Engine.manager.set.getInt("Q3 Ending Price");
            info[6] = Engine.manager.set.getInt("Q4 Ending Price");
        }
        
        catch(Exception error) {
            error.printStackTrace();
        }
        
        return info;
    }

And here’s the error:

java.sql.SQLException
        at com.mysql.jdbc.SQLError.createSQLException(SQLError.java:1055)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.SQLError.createSQLException(SQLError.java:956)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.SQLError.createSQLException(SQLError.java:926)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.ResultSetImpl.checkRowPos(ResultSetImpl.java:815)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.ResultSetImpl.getInt(ResultSetImpl.java:2593)
        at com.mysql.jdbc.ResultSetImpl.getInt(ResultSetImpl.java:2734)
        at com.zymus.zenith.stock.Stocks.getInfo(Stocks.java:84)
        at com.zymus.zenith.stock.Stocks.loadStockInfo(Stocks.java:365)
        at com.zymus.zenith.stock.Stocks.<init>(Stocks.java:28)
        at com.zymus.zenith.Engine.<init>(Engine.java:94)
        at com.zymus.zenith.StockServer.main(StockServer.java:44)

Read full topic
